meanings.definition: To deposit money in a bank.
meanings.sent1: I banked my birthday money to save for a new toy.
meanings.sent2: She always banks her earnings to ensure financial security.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank banked all the coins happily.
meanings.sent4: His trust in the bank was so strong, he banked every paycheck without fail.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel banked acorns for the winter, just like we bank money for emergencies.

meanings.definition: To tilt or incline in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The airplane banked to the left before landing.
meanings.sent2: The cyclist banked smoothly around the curve.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully banked around the corner chasing a toy.
meanings.sent4: The river banked sharply to the right, surprising the canoeists.
meanings.sent5: The tree banked gracefully in the wind, its branches swaying gently.

meanings.definition: To rely on or trust in something.
meanings.sent1: I banked on my friend to help me with the project.
meanings.sent2: She banked on her experience to guide her through the challenge.
meanings.sent3: The student banked on luck to pass the exam without studying.
meanings.sent4: He banked on the weather forecast for his outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: The team banked on teamwork to achieve their goal.
